questions.question_text:
What will be the unit digit of the squares of the following numbers?
(i) 81
(ii) 272
(iii) 799
(iv) 3853
(v) 1234
(vi) 26387
(vii) 52698
(viii) 99880
(ix) 12796
(x) 55555
hints: Observe the unit digit of each number
Recall that squares end with 0,1,4,5,6,9 only
Check pattern: numbers ending with 1 or 9 give squares ending with 1
Numbers ending with 4 or 6 give squares ending with 6

questions.question_text:

(i) 1057
(ii) 23453
(iii) 7928
(iv) 222222
(v) 64000
(vi) 89722
(vii) 222000
(viii) 505050
hints: Check unit digit - perfect squares end with 0,1,4,5,6,9
For numbers ending with zeros, count zeros - must be even
Some numbers may have wrong unit digit or odd zeros

questions.question_text:
The squares of which of the following would be odd numbers?
(i) 431
(ii) 2826
(iii) 7779
(iv) 82004
hints: Square of odd number is odd
Square of even number is even
Check if number is odd or even
Pattern: 1 followed by zeros, then 2, then zeros, then 1
Number of zeros equals (n-1) where number is 1 followed by n zeros then 1
Middle number increases by 1 each time
Sum of first n odd numbers = n²

questions.question_text:
(i) Express 49 as the sum of 7 odd numbers.
(ii) Express 121 as the sum of 11 odd numbers.
hints: 49 = 7², so sum of first 7 odd numbers
121 = 11², so sum of first 11 odd numbers
